name: OpenSSF Scorecard
description: Automated security health metrics for open source projects

checks.name: Binary-Artifacts
checks.description: Project does not contain checked-in binary artifacts
checks.risk: Binary artifacts can contain malicious code difficult to detect
checks.remediation: Remove binary files, use package managers
checks.detection: Scans for binary file types in repository

checks.name: Branch-Protection
checks.description: Branch protection enabled on default and release branches
checks.risk: Unprotected branches allow direct pushes bypassing review

checks.name: CI-Tests
checks.description: Project runs tests in CI before merging PRs
checks.risk: Without CI tests, bugs and vulnerabilities may go undetected
checks.remediation: Add CI workflow that runs tests on pull requests

checks.name: CII-Best-Practices
checks.description: Project has earned OpenSSF Best Practices Badge
checks.risk: May not follow security best practices
checks.remediation: Complete OpenSSF Best Practices Badge questionnaire

checks.name: Code-Review
checks.description: All changes are reviewed before merging
checks.risk: Unreviewed code may contain vulnerabilities or backdoors
checks.remediation: Require code review for all PRs

checks.name: Contributors
checks.description: Project has multiple contributors from different organizations
checks.risk: Single contributor projects have higher bus factor risk

checks.name: Dangerous-Workflow
checks.description: Project avoids dangerous CI workflow patterns
checks.risk: Vulnerable CI can lead to supply chain compromise
dangerous_patterns: pull_request_target with explicit checkout of PR
checks.remediation: Audit and fix dangerous workflow patterns

checks.name: Dependency-Update-Tool
checks.description: Project uses automated dependency update tools
checks.risk: Outdated dependencies may have known vulnerabilities

checks.name: Fuzzing
checks.remediation: Integrate with OSS-Fuzz or add fuzzing tests

checks.name: Maintained
checks.risk: Unmaintained projects may have unpatched vulnerabilities

checks.name: Packaging
checks.description: Project publishes packages using secure practices
checks.risk: Insecure packaging can lead to supply chain attacks
checks.remediation: Use GitHub Actions with SLSA provenance

checks.name: Pinned-Dependencies
checks.description: Dependencies are pinned to specific versions/hashes
checks.risk: Unpinned deps can be hijacked via version updates

checks.name: SAST
checks.description: Project uses Static Application Security Testing
checks.remediation: Enable CodeQL or other SAST in CI

checks.name: Security-Policy
checks.description: Project has SECURITY.md with vulnerability disclosure process
checks.risk: No clear way to report vulnerabilities

checks.name: Signed-Releases
checks.risk: Unsigned releases can be tampered with
remediation: Sign releases with GPG or Sigstore

checks.name: Token-Permissions
checks.risk: Overprivileged tokens increase blast radius of compromise
remediation: Set permissions: read-all at workflow level

checks.name: Vulnerabilities
checks.description: Project has no unfixed vulnerabilities in OSV database

checks.name: Webhooks
checks.risk: Insecure webhooks can leak secrets or be hijacked
checks.remediation: Use HTTPS webhooks with secret validation

github_action.example:
uses: ossf/scorecard-action@v2
with:
  results_format: sarif
  publish_results: true

slsa.relationship: Scorecard checks align with SLSA requirements

supply_chain_security.note: Use with SLSA for comprehensive supply chain security

badges.note: Add badge to README to display score

agent_usage.ci_cd_security: Audit CI workflows against Scorecard checks
agent_usage.security_posture: Quick assessment of project security health
agent_usage.remediation_guidance: Use check details for improvement recommendations
